comments: Professor Radin really keeps class interesting for it being an 8:30. She\'s really nice, approachable, and really funny. Attendance is a huge portion of your grade and DO NOT be late. Class is really easy, bring a laptop. She gives great life/career/job advice. Class consists of a few assignments (easy) 3 tests, 1 paper. Never used the textbook.

comments: She\'s nice... but she has way too much energy for an 8 30 am class. She expects you to be there right on 8 30 and if you\'re a min late she closes the attendance and marks you as late. She\'s super strict on attendance. She\'s a bit too intense for me since i\'m a mellow person. if you have high energy in the morning take her. super preppy.

comments: Professor Radin was a great professor who clearly loves what she teaches. She is very passionate and her lessons about budgeting are eye opening. Attendance is 30% of the grade but her classes are fun to attend. Definitely would recommend and take again!

comments: Took a 7 am class just to have her as a management professor and it was the BEST decision. She has an outgoing personality. Quizzes/ exams are all on Canvas but you have to be on time for class. A knowledgeable AND personable professor is hard to find at MSU so definitely take her if you have the chance. She reassured my decision to major in MGMT!

tag_professor: Amazing lectures (6)  Hilarious (5)  Gives good feedback (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  Inspirational (4)  Respected (3)  Caring (3)  Get ready to read (2)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: This is the second class I took Prof. Radin for. I purposely choose an 8am class just so I could take her again. Students who dislike her typically don\'t enjoy participating in class. She will force you add something to the class. Don\'t just expect to sit there. She is gives tons of real life advice. She makes every class fun and lively.

comments: Great knowledgable prof. 1 group presentation on Whole Foods, 2 exams from text, hw isn\'t too hard, doesn\'t overwhelm you with loads of hw, and a final. really knows what she\'s talking about based on her experience. Teaches things u will actually use in life. i recommend her, i would take her again if i could. Big on attendance, DONT be late!

comments: Melissa is a great professor who knows what she is teaching and talking about. Her lectures are very practical for todays business world. If you want a class that is engaging, this is the one! highly recommended!

tag_professor: Amazing lectures (6)  Hilarious (5)  Gives good feedback (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  Inspirational (4)  Respected (3)  Caring (3)  Get ready to read (2)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Her class fills up almost instantly! She\'s an amazing teacher who has a ton of real-world knowledge in her lectures. Her stories are hilarious and she allows computers during class. I didn\'t use the book at all. I strongly recommend her. There\'s about 3 tests and are based almost completely on the slides. She assigns a little hw but they\'re easy.

comments: Professor Radin is by far my favorite professor at MSUl. I had this class for 2 1/2 hours starting at 8:30am and I did not mind at all. Her lectures are interesting, she is engaging, and gives funny examples. You do not have a lot of homework, only 1 group project and 3 tests but make sure you come to class on time. She cares about her students

comments: Great professor because she gives real world example from her own profession and her own experiences, while keeping the class fun and entertaining. Even though this is in the general electives category for many classes, I would STRONGLY recommend taking her if you want to go into the Management field of work.

comments: Awesome Professor! Knowledgeable in her field. Wants all her students to succeed. Provides helpful tools and motivates you to do better and achieve your goals. Don\'t be late to class. Work extra hard on group project (it pays off). Go over her ppt\'s for the multiple choice exams. Participate in class. Very fair grader. Gives you great life advice!

comments: hands down one of my favorite professors at msu. She knows what she is talking about and she cares about her students. She\'s not a push over, but she is very fair. go to class and do the work and you\'ll get a good grade. take her, she\'s the best!!!!

comments: Radin is probably my favorite professor at MSU, she\'s extremely helpful and down to earth. She makes takes the material and relates it back to her own life making it much easier to understand. Shes very passionate about what she does and really puts confidence in her students. She doesn\'t give a lot of assignments or exams either.

comments: Professor Radin is very knowledgeable in her field of work. She\'s had so many different jobs and is an expert. Attendance is 30% so thats a grade booster! 3 exams, all on the power points (must study), 5 homework assignments fairly easy, and extra credit is offered

comments: Attendance 100% mandatory, and can\'t be late. She teaches what each person has to know to become a successful manager. Lot of activities in class and clear explanation. Exams are kind of tough so you must study and there is no review for her exams. Couple of easy homework and a group presentation. This Prof makes you confident which is rly good.

comments: Do the readings prior to class, make sure you are on time to class everyday. Great activities during class. She has the most amazing stories and cares about her students.

tag_professor: Amazing lectures (6)  Hilarious (5)  Gives good feedback (5)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  Inspirational (4)  Respected (3)  Caring (3)  Get ready to read (2)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: You HAVE to go to class! Attendance is 30% of the grade. She says the textbook is required, but I got an A without it. The lectures are boring, but the activities are fun. You have to do a group presentation, three exams, and a couple homework assignments. It\'s a lot of work, but not hard at all.
